title: 820-3115 left shift, control, option not working
message:
These three keys are not working. Keyboard connector looks good. PP3V42 is present. When keys are pressed, they go high to 3.42V.

Any ideas?

title: 820-3115 left shift, control, option not working
message: Check around U5750...

title: 820-3115 left shift, control, option not working
message:
What should I be looking there exactly?

PP3V3_S4 is 3.3V
SMC_TPAD_RST_L is 3.45V
PP3V42_G3H is 3.45V.

title: 820-3115 left shift, control, option not working
message: For example, when I press Option key, U5701 pin 56 goes high to 3.42V.

title: 820-3115 left shift, control, option not working
message:
The 3 keys pass through U5750, before U5701.
You cannot make SMC reset, or none of them works independent?

title: 820-3115 left shift, control, option not working
message:
Yes, the keys pass through U5750 before reaching U5701. 
You mean PRAM reset? I did SMC by removing battery and power and holding power button for 10 seconds.

title: 820-3115 left shift, control, option not working
message:
The combination of these 3 keys makes SMC manual reset.
My question, you cannot do that, or none of the keys works independently?
What is your ptoblem exactly?

title: 820-3115 left shift, control, option not working
message: I cannot do that and none of the keys work independently.

title: 820-3115 left shift, control, option not working
message:
Right Alt, Option keys work?
The rest of keyboard is all OK?

title: 820-3115 left shift, control, option not working
message: Correct. They both work and rest of the keyboard works.

title: 820-3115 left shift, control, option not working
message: Then change U5750.

title: 820-3115 left shift, control, option not working
message: Even though it has correct values as well as when keys are pressed?

title: 820-3115 left shift, control, option not working
message: I've changed U5750, no luck. Even reflowed the old one with flux in case it had some crap under it.

title: 820-3115 left shift, control, option not working
message:
I've also changed U5701 and J5713, no luck. 

I understand if one of those three keys are not working, meaning bad trace or something else, but all three of them not working, even after changing the three components mentioned. Plus, signals are present and I tested a good known keyboard.

title: 820-3115 left shift, control, option not working
message: Post voltage at U5701 pins.

title: 820-3115 left shift, control, option not working
820-3115 left shift, control, option not working
message:
Sorry, need U5750 voltages.
However, we take a look to U5701 values...

title: 820-3115 left shift, control, option not working
message: So what would be my next step here please?

title: 820-3115 left shift, control, option not working
message:
U5750 is the common thing on these 3 keys.
If none of them works, and traces to/from U5750 are surely good, this is a f***g poltergeist...

title: 820-3115 left shift, control, option not working
message: I don’t see any other logic too.

title: 820-3115 left shift, control, option not working
message:
You probably messed something to check in that area.
J5713 - U5750 - U5701.
Check again all traces and post U5750 voltages...
